Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api

Interface TransactionCommitProcess

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ReadOnlyTransactionCommitProcess, TransactionRepresentationCommitProcess
    public interface TransactionCommitProcess
    This interface represents the contract for committing a batch of transactions. While the concept of a transaction is captured in TransactionRepresentation, commit requires some more information to proceed, since a transaction can come from various sources (normal commit, recovery etc) each of which can be committed but requires different/additional handling. A simple implementation of this would be to append to a log and then apply the commands of the representation to storage that generated them. Another could instead serialize the transactions over the network to another machine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      long commit​(TransactionToApply batch, CommitEvent commitEvent, TransactionApplicationMode mode)
      Commit a batch of transactions.

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        long commit​(TransactionToApply batch,
            CommitEvent commitEvent,
            TransactionApplicationMode mode)
     throws TransactionFailureException
        Commit a batch of transactions. After this method returns the batch of transaction should be committed durably and be recoverable in the event of failure after this point.
        Parameters:
        batch - transactions to commit.
        commitEvent - CommitEvent for traceability.
        mode - The TransactionApplicationMode to use when applying these transactions.
        Returns:
        transaction id of the last committed transaction in this batch.
        Throws:
        TransactionFailureException - If the commit process fails.
